intro: Zapoteca microcephala, commonly known as the little-headed zapoteca, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable in the soil for several years. Zapoteca microcephala is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
